medical_history.chief_complaint: Seeking fertility due to primary amenorrhea and lack of secondary sexual characteristics.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented with primary amenorrhea at age 15, with symptoms persisting over the years. Despite treatment with hormone therapy, she did not experience spontaneous ovulation. At age 26, she was amenorrheic after discontinuing oral contraceptives three months prior. Her symptoms included low LH and FSH levels, with estradiol levels remaining low despite GnRH stimulation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diagnosed with isolated gonadotropin deficiency at age 15. Previous treatments included cyclic Premarin and Provera, and later administration of oral contraceptives until age 20.
medical_history.family_history: No family history of delayed puberty; however, one aunt had infertility of unknown cause. The sister had two healthy children.
medical_history.social_history: Normal diet and no history of excessive exercise or stress.
